memberdef.definition: typedef void(* firmata::FirmataParser::callbackFunction) (void *context, uint8_t command, uint16_t value)
memberdef.name: callbackFunction

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* firmata::FirmataParser::sysexCallbackFunction) (void *context, uint8_t command, size_t argc, uint8_t *argv)
memberdef.name: sysexCallbackFunction

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* firmata::FirmataParser::versionCallbackFunction) (void *context, size_t sv_major, size_t sv_minor, const char *firmware)
memberdef.argsstring: )(void *context, size_t sv_major, size_t sv_minor, const char *firmware)
memberdef.name: versionCallbackFunction

detaileddescription.para:
The FirmataParser class.
dataBuffer
A pointer to an external buffer used to store parsed data
dataBufferSize
The size of the external buffer

Parse data from the input stream.
inputData
A single byte to be added to the parser.

simplesect.para: Returns true if the parser is actively parsing data.

detaileddescription.para:
Provides a mechanism to either set or update the working buffer of the parser. The method will be enabled when no buffer has been provided, or an overflow condition exists.
dataBuffer
A pointer to an external buffer used to store parsed data
dataBufferSize
The size of the external buffer

Attach a generic sysex callback function to a command (options are: ANALOG_MESSAGE, DIGITAL_MESSAGE, REPORT_ANALOG, REPORT DIGITAL, SET_PIN_MODE and SET_DIGITAL_PIN_VALUE).
command
The ID of the command to attach a callback function to.
newFunction
A reference to the callback function to attach.
context
An optional context to be provided to the callback function (NULL by default).
The context parameter is provided so you can pass a parameter, by reference, to your callback function.

Attach a buffer overflow callback
newFunction
A reference to the buffer overflow callback function to attach.
context
An optional context to be provided to the callback function (NULL by default).
The context parameter is provided so you can pass a parameter, by reference, to your callback function.

Attach a callback function for the STRING_DATA command.
command
Must be set to STRING_DATA or it will be ignored.
newFunction
A reference to the string callback function to attach.
context
An optional context to be provided to the callback function (NULL by default).
The context parameter is provided so you can pass a parameter, by reference, to your callback function.

Attach a generic sysex callback function to sysex command.
command
The ID of the command to attach a callback function to.
newFunction
A reference to the sysex callback function to attach.
context
An optional context to be provided to the callback function (NULL by default).
The context parameter is provided so you can pass a parameter, by reference, to your callback function.

Attach a system callback function (supported options are: SYSTEM_RESET, REPORT_VERSION).
command
The ID of the command to attach a callback function to.
newFunction
A reference to the callback function to attach.
context
An optional context to be provided to the callback function (NULL by default).
The context parameter is provided so you can pass a parameter, by reference, to your callback function.

Attach a version callback function (supported option: REPORT_FIRMWARE).
command
The ID of the command to attach a callback function to.
newFunction
A reference to the callback function to attach.
context
An optional context to be provided to the callback function (NULL by default).
The context parameter is provided so you can pass a parameter, by reference, to your callback function.

Detach a callback function for a specified command (such as SYSTEM_RESET, STRING_DATA, ANALOG_MESSAGE, DIGITAL_MESSAGE, etc).
command
The ID of the command to detatch the callback function from.

Detach the buffer overflow callback
<unused>
Any pointer of type dataBufferOverflowCallbackFunction.

Buffer abstraction to prevent memory corruption
data
The byte to put into the buffer
pos
The position to insert the byte into the buffer
writeError A boolean to indicate if an error occured

Transform 7-bit firmata message into 8-bit stream
bytec
The encoded data byte length of the message (max: 16383).
bytev
A pointer to the encoded array of data bytes.
The length of the decoded data.
The conversion will be done in place on the provided buffer.
Process incoming sysex messages. Handles REPORT_FIRMWARE and STRING_DATA internally. Calls callback function for STRING_DATA and all other sysex messages.
Resets the system state upon a SYSTEM_RESET message from the host software.
